abstract: The Long Island village, which has been hit by foreclosures, is protesting the bank’s lending and foreclosure policies by ending a relationship of more than 20 years.
snippet: The Long Island village, which has been hit by foreclosures, is protesting the bank’s lending and foreclosure policies by ending a relationship of more than 20 years.
lead_paragraph: The village of Hempstead on Long Island is pulling its money from JPMorgan Chase and severing its ties with the bank to protest lending and foreclosure policies, according to local officials there.

headline.main: Hempstead, in Protest, Is Severing Ties With Chase
